title: Tony Jimenez, Founder, President and CEO of MicroTech, Tells Story of Survival in Washington SmartCEO Magazine Front Page Feature
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/3/2015 @ 6:10 AM Companies mentioned in this article: MicroTech 
MCLEAN, Va., Sept. 3, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- SmartCEO magazine recently profiled Tony Jimenez, Founder, President and CEO of MicroTech, in the publication's September/October 2015 Washington edition. The lead story shares a behind-the-scenes look at a local success story, and the adversity that Jimenez and his company have overcome. 
Washington SmartCEO is a regional "growing company" publication aimed at providing resources each month to help educate, motivate and inspire Washington decision-makers. 
"I've always been a firm believer that if you do the right thing, right things will result," said Jimenez in an interview with Washington SmartCEO . "If you follow the rules and you pay attention, and you treat people the way you want to be treated, and you perform at the highest level you're capable of performing, good things will happen." 
Founded in 2004, MicroTech - one of the most innovative and fastest growing tech providers in the US - rose to top the top quickly. Eleven years later, Jimenez is now the 100-percent owner of a MicroTech that receives better contracts than ever before, boasts a dedicated workforce, and is positioned for steady growth moving forward. 
In his exclusive interview with Washington SmartCEO, Tony detailed overcoming inquiries triggered by an investigative journalist's ill-informed crusade and disproving their specious allegations. "In the end," Jimenez added, "you hope to be an ethical, amazing-looking company that will withstand scrutiny...today I know that being a business owner is kind of like sailing around the ocean. You're not going to encounter calm seas the entire trip." 
MicroTech was also named one of Washington SmartCEO magazine's "Future 50" winners in 2010, 2011, 2012*, 2013*, and 2014* (*denotes large Blue Chip category). The Future 50 Awards program recognizes the 50 fastest-growing mid-sized companies in the Greater Washington area across multiple industries. These companies represent the future of the region's economy and embody the entrepreneurial spirit critical for leadership and success. 
In 2011, Jimenez was selected as a "Circle of Excellence" winner by SmartCEO , as the No. 1 leader of a for-profit organization in the Washington area who supports and directly participates in philanthropic acts. 
SmartCEO magazine caters to nearly 50,000 offensive-minded, growth-oriented CEOs who turn to the publication to find ideas and inspiration to help them grow their businesses. SmartCEO magazine is published on a bimonthly basis with editions in four major markets: Baltimore SmartCEO , New York SmartCEO , Philadelphia SmartCEO and Washington SmartCEO . 
Visit SmartCEO magazine for the full text online , or view the full September/October 2015 edition here . 
About MicroTech 
MicroTech, a premier Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), is an industry leading prime contractor on more than 100 Federal projects and holds more than 20 procurement vehicles, offering access to 2500 vendors and over a million technology products and services. The nationally recognized company is also certified by the National Minority Supplier Development Council (NMSDC). Founded in 2004, MicroTech expertly provides Technology Integration, Telecom Solutions, Network Systems, Cloud Computing, Product Support, Managed Service Solutions, and Unified Communications to commercial enterprises, as well as the public sector -- managing over half-a-million technology users daily.
